mcvis 0.2.11
  • Get started
  • Reference

Multi-collinearity Visualization

mcvis.Rd

Multi-collinearity Visualization

mcvis(X, sampling_method = "bootstrap",
  standardise_method = "euclidean", times = 1000L, k = 10L)

Arguments

X

A matrix of regressors (without intercept terms).
sampling_method

The resampling method for the data. Currently supports "bootstrap" or "cv" (cross-validation).
standardise_method

The standardisation method for the data. Currently supports "euclidean" (default, centred by mean and divide by Euclidiean length) and "studentise" (centred by mean and divide by standard deviation) and "none" (no standardisation)
times

Number of resampling runs we perform. Default is set to 1000.
k

Number of partitions in averaging theMC index. Default is set to 10.

Value

A list of outputs:

  • X: The original matrix of regressors (for plotting purposes)

  • t_square: The t^2 statistics for the regression between the VIFs and the tau's.

  • MC: The MC indices

  • col.names: Column names (for plotting purposes)

Examples

set.seed(1)
p = 10
n = 100
X = matrix(rnorm(n*p), ncol = p)
X[,1] = X[,2] + rnorm(n, 0, 0.1)
mcvis_result = mcvis(X)
mcvis_result$MC
#>             col1       col2         col3         col4         col5         col6
#> tau10 0.14701287 0.14285974 1.136328e-01 1.060217e-01 1.951976e-01 4.660954e-02
